meanings.definition: To govern or manage poorly or unjustly.
meanings.sent1: The king was misruling his kingdom, causing chaos and unhappiness among the people.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of misruling the company, leading it to financial ruin.
meanings.sent3: The misruling mayor thought he could make everyone happy, but ended up causing more problems.
meanings.sent4: Her misruling of the project turned it into a complete disaster.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's misruling of the classroom led to a lack of discipline and learning.

meanings.definition: The act of ruling or governing in a bad or unjust manner.
meanings.sent1: The misruling of the country by the dictator led to widespread suffering.
meanings.sent2: The misruling of the organization resulted in many employees quitting.
meanings.sent3: The misruling of the school board made the students feel like they were in a never-ending comedy show.
meanings.sent4: The misruling of the land by the greedy corporation left it barren and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: The misruling of the team by the coach caused them to lose every game.
